Name: City Art Centre
Details: Enjoy a visit to the City Art Centre, a main Edinburgh art gallery with one of the best collections of Scottish art. We show interesting exhibitions from our own collections and from all over the world. We can also tempt you with an excellent café and attractive shop located on the ground floor.

Name: Lauriston Castle
Details: When you step inside Lauriston Castle, you see it just as it was in 1926, when it was left to the nation by the last private owner, Mrs Reid.
Opening Hours: April through October:Every day except Fri, 2pmNovember through March:Sat-Sun, 2pm

Name: Museum Collections Centre
Details: This centre houses the reserve collections of the city museums. There are many interesting objects on open storage display, especially social history objects, decorative art and archaeology collections.
Opening Hours:
General tours on the first Tuesday of the month, 2pm and 3pm
Or by appointment

Name: Museum of Childhood
Details: The Museum of Childhood is a fun day out for the whole family. Young people can learn about the children of the past and see a fantastic range of toys and games, while adults enjoy a trip down memory lane.

Name: Museum of Edinburgh
Details: The Museum of Edinburgh is the Citys treasure box - a maze of historic rooms crammed full of iconic objects from the Capitals past.

Name: Nelson Monument
Details: The Nelson Monument was built in memory of Admiral Lord Nelson, who died at the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805. Weather permitting, the Trafalgar flag signal 'England expects that every man will do his duty' is still flown on Trafalgar Day (21 October).
Opening Hours:
April through September:
Mon, 1pm-6pm
Tue-Sat, 10am-6pm
October through March:
Mon-Sat, 10am-3pm

Name: People's Story Museum
Details: The Peoples Story explores the lives of Edinburghs ordinary people at work and play from the late 18th century to today. Visitors can see displays showing a bookbinders workshop, a wartime kitchen and much more, all packed with real objects. You can even see a former jail, an original part of this historic building.

Name: Queensferry Museum
Details: Queensferry Museum helps visitors to explore the past and traditions of historic Queensferry and neighbouring Dalmeny.
Opening Hours:
Mon, Thu, Fri, Sat, 10am-1pm and 2.15pm-5pm
Sun 12pm-5pm

Name: Scott Monument
Details: The Scott Monument is the largest monument to a writer in the world. It commemorates Sir Walter Scott.
Opening Hours: April through September: 10am-7pm. October through March: 10am-4pm

Name: Travelling Gallery
Details: The Travelling Gallery is a unique, beautiful, self-contained, custom-built mobile art gallery, which brings contemporary art exhibitions into schools and communities throughout Scotland.
Opening Hours: Find out where we are on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Travelling-Gallery/169833953852?ref=ts

Name: Writers' Museum
Details: The Writers Museum celebrates the lives of three great Scottish writers  Robert Burns, Sir Walter Scott and Robert Louis Stevenson.
Address: Lady Stair's House, Lady Stairs Close, Lawnmarket
